column2: State-of-the-art Question Answering (QA)
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column centered left-indent right-indent hanged-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: systems are very sensitive to variations
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column centered left-indent right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: in the phrasing of an information need.
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column centered left-indent right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: Finding the preferred language for such
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column centered left-indent right-indent aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: a need is a valuable task. We investi-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column centered left-indent right-indent aligned-line itemization headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: gate that claim by adopting a simple MT-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column centered left-indent right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: based paraphrasing technique and evalu-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column centered left-indent right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ating QA system performance on para-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column centered left-indent right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: phrased questions. We found a potential
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column centered left-indent right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: increase of 35% in MRR with respect to
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column centered left-indent right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the original question.

column2: 1 Introduction
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column right-indent font-larger hanged-line shorter-tail line-double-space line-space numbered-heading1 above-double-space above-line-space

column2: In a typical Question Answering system, an input
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: question is analyzed to formulate a query to re-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: trieve relevant documents from a target corpus (Chu-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: Carroll et al., 2006; Harabagiu et al., 2006; Sun
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-capital

column2: et al., 2006). This analysis of the input question
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-lower

column2: affects the subset of documents that will be exam-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ined and ultimately plays a key role in determining
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the answers the system chooses to produce. How-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ever, most existing QA systems, whether they adopt
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: knowledge-based, statistical, or hybrid methods, are
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: very sensitive to small variations in the question
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: form, often yielding substantially different answers
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: for questions that are semantically equivalent. For
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: example, our system’s answer to “Who invented the
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: telephone?” is “Alexander Graham Bell;” how-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ever, its top answer to a paraphrase of the above
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: question “Who is credited with the invention of the
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: telephone?” is “Gutenberg,” who is credited with
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the invention of the printing press, while “Alexander
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: Graham Bell,” who is credited with the invention of
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: the telephone, appears in rank four.
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space
page=0 xpos=4 ypos=9 left-column left-indent right-over indented-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space numeric-only column-bottom

column2: Jennifer Chu-Carroll

column2: jencc@us.ibm.com
column3: page=0 xpos=6 ypos=1 right-column left-indent right-indent font-smallest indented-line shorter-tail line-space symbol-atmark headchar-lower above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: To demonstrate the ubiquity of this phenomenon,
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column left-indent hanged-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space headchar-capital tailchar-comma

column2: we asked the aforementioned two questions to sev-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: eral QA systems on the web, including LCC’s Pow-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: erAnswer system, <sup>1</sup> MIT’s START system, 2 Answer-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified font-largest aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: Bus, <sup>3</sup> and Ask Jeeves. 4 All systems exhibited dif-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified font-largest aligned-line headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: ferent behavior for the two phrasings of the ques-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tion, ranging from minor variations in documents
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: presented to justify an answer, to major differences
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: such as the presence of correct answers in the answer
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: list. For some systems, the more complex question
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: form posed sufficient difficulty that they chose not
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: to answer it.
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-line-space

column2: In this paper we focus on investigating a high risk
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail line-space headchar-capital

column2: but potentially high payoff approach, that of improv-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ing system performance by replacing the user ques-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tion with a paraphrased version of it. To obtain can-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: didate paraphrases, we adopt a simple yet powerful
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: technique based on machine translation, which we
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: describe in the next section. Our experimental re-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: sults show that we can potentially achieve a 35% rel-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ative improvement in system performance if we have
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: an oracle that always picks the optimal paraphrase
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: for each question. Our ultimate goal is to automat-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ically select from the set of candidates a high po-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tential paraphrase using a component trained against
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the QA system. In Section 3, we present our ini-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tial approach to paraphrase selection which shows
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: that, despite the tremendous odds against selecting
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: performance-improving paraphrases, our conserva-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tive selection algorithm resulted in marginal im-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: provement in system performance.
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 2 MT-Based Automatic Paraphrasing
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column right-indent font-larger column-top line-blank-line line-double-space line-space numbered-heading1 above-double-space above-line-space

column2: To measure the impact of paraphrases on QA sys-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: tems, we seek to adopt a methodology by which
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: paraphrases can be automatically generated from a
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: user question. Inspired by the use of parallel trans-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: lations to mine paraphrasing lexicons (Barzilay and
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: McKeown, 2001) and the use of MT engines for
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-capital

column2: word sense disambiguation (Diab, 2000), we lever-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: age existing machine translation systems to generate
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: semantically equivalent, albeit lexically and syntac-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tically distinct, questions.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-line-space

column2: Figure 1 (A) illustrates how MT-based paraphras-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail line-space string-figure headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: ing captures lexical paraphrasing, ranging from ob-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: taining simple synonyms such as hazardous and
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: dangerous to deriving more complex equivalent
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: phrases such as expectant mother and pregnant
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: woman. In addition to lexical paraphrasing, some
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: two-way translations achieve structural paraphras-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ing, as illustrated by the example in Figure 1 (B).
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-line-space

column2: Using multiple MT engines can help paraphrase
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail line-space headchar-capital

column2: diversity. For example, in Figure 1 (B), if we use the
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: @promt translator <sup>5</sup> for English-to-Spanish transla-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified font-largest aligned-line symbol-atmark tailchar-hiphen

column2: tion and Babelfish <sup>6</sup> for Spanish-to-English transla-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified font-largest aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tion, we get “Find out on the nuclear armament
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: program of India” where both lexical and struc-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tural paraphrasings are observed.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-line-space

column2: The motivation of generating an array of lexically
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail line-space headchar-capital

column2: and structurally distinct paraphrases is that some of
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: these paraphrases may better match the processing
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: capabilities of the underlying QA system than the
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: original question and are thus more likely to pro-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: duce correct answers. Our observation is that while
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the paraphrase set contains valuable performance-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: improving phrasings, it also includes a large num-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ber of ungrammatical sentences which need to be fil-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 3 Using Automatic Paraphrasing in
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column right-indent font-larger aligned-line shorter-tail line-double-space line-space numbered-heading1

column2: Question Answering
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column left-indent right-indent font-larger indented-line shorter-tail headchar-capital above-double-space above-line-space

column2: We use a generic architecture (Figure 2) that treats
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified hanged-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: a QA system as a black box that is invoked after a
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line itemization headchar-lower

column2: paraphrase generation module, a feature extraction
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: module, and a paraphrase selection module are exe-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: cuted. The preprocessing modules identifies a para-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: phrase of the original question, which could be the
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: question itself, to send as input to the QA system.
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: A key advantage of treating the core QA system as
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: a black box is that the preprocessing modules can
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line itemization headchar-lower

column2: be easily applied to improve the performance of any
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: QA system. <sup>7</sup>
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column right-indent font-largest aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-capital

column2: We described the paraphrase generation module
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: in the previous section and will discuss the remain-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ing two modules below.
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Feature Extraction Module. For each possible
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: paraphrase, we compare it against the original ques-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tion and compute the features shown in Table 1.
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: These are a subset of the features that we have ex-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: perimented with and have found to be meaningful
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: for the task. All of these features are required in or-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 7 In our earlier experiments, we adopted an approach that
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column left-indent indented-line line-double-space line-space numbered-heading1

column2: combines answers to all paraphrases through voting. These ex-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified font-smallest hanged-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: periments proved unsuccessful: in most cases, the answer to the
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified font-smallest aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: original question was amplified, both when right and wrong.
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column right-indent font-smallest aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period page-bottom

column2: __Table 1__
column3: page=2 xpos=-1 ypos=-3 single-column left-over right-indent box page-top table-area above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Table 1: Our features, computed for each paraphrase by comparing it against the original question.
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=0 single-column centered left-indent right-indent indented-line line-double-space line-space string-table headchar-capital tailchar-period column-bottom above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: der not to lower the performance with respect to the
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified column-top line-blank-line line-double-space line-space headchar-lower

column2: original question. They are ordered by their relative
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: contributions to the error rate reduction.
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Paraphrase Selection Module. To select a para-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: phrase, we used JRip, the Java re-implementation of
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: ripper (Cohen, 1996), a supervised rule learner in
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-lower

column2: the Weka toolkit (Witten and Frank, 2000).
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail year headchar-lower tailchar-period above-line-space

column2: We initially formulated paraphrase selection as a
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail line-space headchar-capital

column2: three-way classification problem, with an attempt to
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: label each paraphrase as being “worse,” the “same,”
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: or “better” than the original question. Our objective
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: was to replace the original question with a para-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: phrase labeled “better.” However, the priors for
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: these classes are roughly 30% for “worse,” 65% for
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: “same,” and 5% for “better”. Our empirical evi-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line tailchar-hiphen

column2: dence shows that successfully pinpointing a “better”
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: paraphrase improves, on average, the reciprocal rank
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: for a question by 0.5, while erroneously picking a
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: “worse” paraphrase results in a 0.75 decrease. That
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line

column2: is to say, errors are 1.5 times more costly than suc-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: cesses (and five times more likely). This scenario
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: strongly suggests that a high precision algorithm is
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: critical for this component to be effective.
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-line-space

column2: To increase precision, we took two steps. First,
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail line-space headchar-capital tailchar-comma

column2: we trained a cascade of two binary classifiers. The
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: first one classifies “worse” versus “same or better,”
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: with a bias for “worse.” The second classifier has
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: classes “worse or same” versus “better,” now with a
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: bias towards “better.” The second step is to constrain
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the confidence of the classifier and only accept para-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: phrases where the second classifier has a 100% con-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: fidence. These steps are necessary to avoid decreas-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ing performance with respect to the original ques-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tion, as we will show in the next section.
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space
page=2 xpos=4 ypos=9 left-column left-indent right-over indented-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space numeric-only column-bottom

column2: 4 Experimental Results
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column right-indent font-larger column-top numbered-heading1 above-double-space above-line-space

column2: We trained the paraphrase selection module us-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: ing our QA system, PIQUANT (Chu-Carroll et al.,
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: 2006). Our target corpus is the AQUAINT corpus,
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line year tailchar-comma

column2: employed in the TREC QA track since 2002.
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail year headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: As for MT engines, we employed Babelfish
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: and Google MT, <sup>8</sup> rule-based systems developed by
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified font-largest hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: S Y S T R A N and Google, respectively. We adopted
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: different MT engines based on the hypothesis that
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: differences in their translation rules will improve the
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: effectiveness of the paraphrasing module.
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: To measure performance, we trained and tested by
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: cross-validation over 712 questions from the TREC
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: 9 and 10 datasets. We paraphrased the questions us-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line numbered-heading1 tailchar-hiphen

column2: ing the four possible combinations of MT engines
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: with up to 11 intermediate languages, obtaining a
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: total of 15,802 paraphrases. These questions were
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: then fed to our system and evaluated per TREC an-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: swer key. We obtained a baseline MRR (top five
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: answers) of 0.345 running over the original ques-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tions. An oracle run, in which the best paraphrase
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: (or the original question) is always picked would
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line

column2: yield a MRR of 0.48. This potential increase is sub-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: stantial, taking into account that a 35% improve-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ment separated the tenth participant from the sec-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ond in TREC-9. Our three-fold cross validation us-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ing the features and algorithm described in Section 3
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: yielded a MRR of 0.347. Over 712 questions, it re-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: placed 14, two of which improved performance, the
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: rest stayed the same. On the other hand, random
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: selection of paraphrases decreased performance to
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: 0.156, clearly showing the importance of selecting a
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line

column2: good paraphrase.
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 8 http://translate.google.com
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column left-indent right-indent font-smaller indented-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space numbered-heading1 page-bottom

column2: 5 Related Work
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column right-indent font-larger page-top numbered-heading1 above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Most of the work in QA and paraphrasing focused
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: on folding paraphrasing knowledge into the question
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: analyzer or the answer locator (Rinaldi et al., 2003;
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-lower tailchar-semicolon

column2: Tomuro, 2003). Our work, on the contrary, focuses
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-capital

column2: on question paraphrasing as an external component,
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: independent of the QA system architecture.
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: Some authors (Dumais et al., 2002; Echihabi et
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail year headchar-capital

column2: al., 2004) considered the query sent to a search en-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified hanged-line year headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: gine as a “paraphrase” of the original natural lan-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: guage question. For instance, Echihabi et al. (2004)
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-lower

column2: presented a large number of “reformulations” that
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: transformed the query into assertions that could
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: match the answers in text. Here we understand a
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: question paraphrase as a reformulation that is itself
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: a question, not a search engine query.
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail itemization headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: Other efforts in using paraphrasing for QA
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: (Duclaye et al., 2003) focused on using the Web
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified hanged-line year

column2: to obtain different verbalizations for a seed relation
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: (e.g., Author/Book); however, they have yet to apply
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line

column2: their learned paraphrases to QA.
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: Recently, there has been work on identifying para-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: phrases equivalence classes for log analysis (Hed-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: strom, 2005). Hedstrom used a vector model from
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-lower

column2: Information Retrieval that inspired our cosine mea-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: sure feature described in Section 3.
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 6 Conclusions
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column right-indent font-larger aligned-line shorter-tail line-double-space line-space numbered-heading1 above-double-space above-line-space

column2: The work presented here makes contributions at
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: three different levels. First, we have shown that po-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tential impact of paraphrasing with respect to QA
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: performance is significant. Replacing a question
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: with a more felicitously worded question can poten-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tially result in a 35% performance increase.
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: Second, we performed our experiments by tap-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: ping into a readily available paraphrase resource:
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower tailchar-colon

column2: MT engines. Our results speak of the usefulness of
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: the approach in producing paraphrases. This tech-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: nique of obtaining a large, although low quality,
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: set of paraphrases can be easily employed by other
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: NLP practitioners wishing to investigate the impact
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: of paraphrasing on their own problems.
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: Third, we have shown that the task of selecting a
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: better phrasing is amenable to learning, though more
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: work is required to achieve its full potential. In that
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: respect, the features and architecture discussed in
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: Section 3 are a necessary first step in that direction.
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column right-indent aligned-line headchar-capital tailchar-period above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space
page=3 xpos=4 ypos=9 left-column left-indent right-over indented-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space numeric-only column-bottom

column2: In future work, we are interested in developing
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column left-indent column-top headchar-capital

column2: effective filtering techniques to reduce our candidate
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: set to a small number of high precision paraphrases,
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: in experimenting with state-of-the-art paraphrasers,
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: and in using paraphrasing to improve the stability of
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the QA system.
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space
